item.title: Once Human: How To Sell / Trade Deviations
item.description:
Similar to other survival games, there are so many different resources in Once Human that players gather over the course of progressing through the scenarios. While some of them are constantly used to craft better gear or repair existing ones, some other items are left without use; they either don't seem to hold much value to the player, or maybe better variants have been acquired already.

Selling or trading these items, however, is a great way of opening up some space in one's inventory and storage crates while obtaining something useful in return. Deviations, however, used to be an exception to trading for a long time, but an update changed this. For those looking to make use of this feature, here's how to sell/trade deviations in Once Human .

How To Trade Deviations In Once Human

Similar to other items, Deviations can also be traded via the Vending Machine , a device that every player can build in their base after unlocking the Memento of the same name under the Construction category.

Keep in mind that a Vending Machine is an electrified device, which means that having a Generator connected to it is essential.

After building the Vending Machine, there will be a new tab for trading Deviations. Thankfully, the trading options for a Deviation are not limited, which means that a player can offer a Deviation and ask for any other item in return, be it another Deviation, mods, ammo, weapons, or anything else.

Aside from trading for items, players can also trade their Deviation for Energy Links. The maximum number of Energy Links that can be received in return for a Deviation is 99,999, though it is almost impossible to see someone spending that much on a Deviation.

How To Sell Deviations In Once Human

Selling Deviations is only possible in the Eternaland Island Shop . The vendor at the shop will offer a set amount of Astral Sand for each Deviation. The Astral Sand that the player earns from the shop can be spent at the same place to buy new items.

Are Deviations In Once Human Worth Selling Or Trading?

Higher-tier Deviations are indeed worth selling, especially if you have multiple copies of them. The best way is to trade them for the item that you need, but if trading doesn't work, the Island Shop in Eternaland is always an option. The price for Deviations in the shop is usually around 400 or 500 Astral Sand .

That being said, it is recommended to save the Crafting or Territory Deviations rather than selling them, as they boost the progression when starting a new scenario, while Combat Deviations are usually required in the latter half of the game, and by then, you have probably caught new Combat Deviations throughout the scenario. So, selling or trading combat Deviations seems to be a wise choice unless you build your base in a high-level zone.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: 7 Counters To The Thing
item.description:
The best The Thing counters in Marvel Rivals are a particular bunch, important for either movement-disabling or high-damage potential. These are crucial aspects because the Fantastic Four teammate has niche abilities, and works differently than other Vanguards in Marvel Rivals . At launch, he's one of the strongest tanks in the game, and an absolute terror in ranked lobbies if left somehow unbanned.

What makes Marvel Rivals' The Thing dominating is that he comes with two high-functioning movement mechanics and strong melee attacks. He also comes with high base health and can get bonus shields, so it's no surprise that killing him is always the priority. Naturally, the best The Thing counters in Marvel Rivals have become a popular bunch. It can be tough to kill him every single time, but making him much less effective is certainly easier.

This list of Marvel Rivals' The Thing counters is based on aspects such as damage potential, movement-disabling abilities, and ease of evasion.

7 Hela

Very High Damage Numbers And Good Stun

  • Hela's Astral Flock allows her to reposition or evade The Thing.
  • Her damage numbers are some of the best in the game, and the stun is key as well.

Using Hela's kit in Marvel Rivals to counter The Thing is one of the easiest and most impactful plays that players can turn to. Her hitscan projectiles deal a lot of damage, especially the Piercing Night attack. At the moment, Hela does some of the most damage in the game — two headshots are enough to take down a Duelist or Strategist, and one-to-two more for a Vanguard.

Hela's stun is important when dealing with Ben Grimm. Cutting down his movement abilities is important, as those are the best parts of his kit. Further, Astral Flock is effective when trying to reposition to maintain pressure or evade being rundown. Her Team-Up combination in Marvel Rivals of respawning Thor and Loki on the last hit, or giving bonus health, is also impactful as they're chosen often.

6 Moon Knight

High Mobility and Use Of Ancient Ankh To Amplify Damage

  • Moon Knight's Ankh amplifies his damage by a great deal, allowing for quick takedowns.
  • The grappling hook and double jump allow for easy reposition.

Moon Knight is an incredible Duelist in Marvel Rivals , especially for taking down ground-based characters. The key part is that the Ancient Ankh increases the number of hits in a circle, amplifying the damage dealt via his Crescent Darts and Moon Blades. Although it can be destroyed, players can use it to counter Ben Grimm. Placing it in a good spot after the latter's movement mechanics are exhausted will be best.

Moon Knight's evasion mechanics are another part that make him a great Marvel Rivals' The Thing counter. These allow him to maintain pressure and chase so he can't be ignored, and yet be mobile enough to quickly reposition when in danger. Since Ben Grimm can't run up walls, using the grapple and glide to rotate between high points will make Moon Knight untouchable.

5 Mantis

Puts The Thing To Sleep, Disables Key Parts Of His Kit

  • Mantis' sleep spore nips The Thing's kit in the bud.
  • Damage-boosting self or an ally is great in any matchup.

Choosing Mantis as one of The Thing counters in Marvel Rivals is straightforward: her Spore Slumber can put him to sleep right away, cutting down his strengths. Since the latter's movement is his strongest point, almost unstoppable and granting bonus health, nipping it in the bud is crucial. And this is where Mantis shines.

Mantis' kit doesn't have movement mechanics in Marvel Rivals , so playing behind teammates is a must. Further, players need to alternate between healing and damage-boosting, especially self, as this makes a lot of difference. Higher-ranked players choose to self-boost more often, dealing damage and getting more Life Orbs. Mantis' team healing is also good, making her a great Strategist and The Thing counter in Marvel Rivals .

4 Groot

Walls For Bonus Damage And Containing The Thing

  • Groot's walls are incredibly helpful in blocking The Thing's movement.
  • Since the recent buff, Groot can place walls from a longer distance.

Using Groot to counter The Thing in Marvel Rivals is simple and effective. He was buffed via Marvel Rivals Season 1.5 update, and can now place walls from a longer distance. Due to this, blocking Ben Grimm from running in to attack or from escaping has been made much easier. Further, this allows players to easily isolate him as well, depriving him of heals or jumping to allies and getting distance and shields.

Players may remember that one type of Groot's walls gives bonus healing to surrounding allies and the other type deals damage to close-by enemies. These amplify the power of Groot's kit in Marvel Rivals fot taking down Ben Grimm. Not only can gamers stop the latter's heals, but they can increase their own. Groot's ultimate also makes light work of everyone by tying them together, easily making him a great The Thing counter in Marvel Rivals .

3 The Punisher

Great Damage Dealer With A Grappling Hook

  • The Punisher's Culling Turret absolutely shreds The Thing's health bar.
  • He can quickly reposition to pressure or evade Ben Grimm.

The Punisher can deal with The Thing in a way almost no other hero can: at any range with a whole lot of damage. The Punisher's kit in Marvel Rivals comes with the Culling Turret, which is immobile, but it does come with 300 shield and over-the-top damage numbers. This is easily one of the fastest, non-ultimate The Thing counters in Marvel Rivals .

The Punisher also deals quite a bit of damage with his assault rifle and shotgun. Not to forget, the smoke grenade is wonderful for causing a bit of chaos. His ultimate brings out two Gatling guns, which, again, easily melt the entire team. The Final Judgement is easily one of the best ultimates in Marvel Rivals , and a ridiculously easy The Thing counter. And in case things go sideways, the grappling gun is always on hand to save the day.

2 Peni Parker

Winning Trio Of Mines, Healing Webs, And Movement-Disables

  • Penny can keep repositioning to pressure or evade The Thing, exhausting his movement abilities.
  • Using webs and mines to confuse and damage Ben brings in interesting mind play.

Peni Parker is an exceptional Marvel Rivals' hero counter to The Thing. Not only does she come with a great Vanguard health pool, but she can also continuously regen healh at a respectable rate of 40 HP/s from her webs. These webs also hide the mines and make them invincible. As such, their impact on damaging enemies and pressuring them into making the wrong plays cannot be overstated. Moreover, creating a web network with mines and the Bionic Spider-Nest will keep indirect damage pressure constantly up.

However, it's the alt-fire that makes the most difference. Since Peni can ensnare enemies, she can easily web up The Thing and cut down his movement abilities. Not only will this keep him at a safe distance, but it will also keep him from evading and getting shields. Essentially, Peni Parker's kit in Marvel Rivals hosts a chunky health bar, health regeneration, indirect damage, movement-cancel, and a whole lot more — these easily make her one of the best The Thing counters in Marvel Rivals .

1 Wolverine

Higher Damage Numbers Against Vanguards

  • Wolverine's damage percentage is based on the enemy's max health; he's lethal against Vanguards.
  • Logan's movement helps close the distance really quickly.

Wolverine may seem an odd choice as a counter to The Thing in Marvel Rivals , considering that the latter cannot be moved by any enemy's ability. This makes him immune to being grabbed and isolated by Logan's movement mechanic. However, that's not the entire point that the latter's kit hinges on, and he remains the top choice for taking down The Thing.

Wolverine's kit in Marvel Rivals comes with a higher-damage-against-max-health mechanic. This means that he always deals better with Vanguards. Given this point, and the fact that he can quickly close the distance, means he's an obvious choice to counter The Thing. Moreover, due to his Rage meter, Wolverine heals himself and deals more damage. These numbers can add up a lot when the meter is full (it fills up quickly), effectively making Logan the best Marvel Rivals ' The Thing counter.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Complete The Whispering Bench Quest
item.description:
Infinity Nikki 's Eerie Season brings with it not only the alluring mystery of Queen Philomia but also an exciting variety of new activities and quests for players to take part in. Many of those quests can lead to valuable rewards that you can then put toward endeavors like the Lingering Finale Resonance Banner.

One of the quests in Infinity Nikki that can slip by like one of Philomia's ghosts is The Whispering Bench, and to complete it you will actually need to interact with some of those ghosts yourself.

How to Unlock The Whispering Bench Quest in Infinity Nikki

Like other quests in Infinity Nikki 's Eerie Season, this one does have a pre-requisite for unlocking it. You must complete the Photo Investigation: Midnight Stories quest first, which is part of the 'Eerie Encounters' category in the 'Tales of Mystery' tab in the Events menu.

Fortunately, it's a brief quest that has you make a pit stop at the Heartcraft Kingdom Outpost at the southernmost point in Breezy Meadow, directly behind the Queen's Palace Ruins. Use the respective Warp Spire to get there quickly.

How to Complete The Whispering Bench Quest in Infinity Nikki

The Whispering Bench quest is part of the Eerie Season's 'Tales of Mystery' event questline, which you can find in your Events menu. Of the two categories of quests found in that tab, select 'Eerie Encounters' and The Whispering Bench is the last option on the list.

Be aware that you must first complete the previous two quests on the list ('Strange Hissing Streetlamp' and 'Photo Investigation: Midnight Stories') to access this one.

After completing Photo Investigation: Midnight Stories with Divinso at the Heartcraft Kingdom Outpost , he will mention a rumor about the benches that surround the violin statue at the castle's entrance. This automatically unlocks The Whispering Bench quest, and you can track its starting point on your map via the 'Eerie Encounters' menu (as seen above).

Travel to the entrance area of the Queen's Palace Ruins (use the Queen's Palace Ruins Entrance Warp Spire) and follow the main path until you reach the large statue of the violin that is swirling with a strange energy. Now you need to wait until nightfall (22:00-4:00), which you can hurry to via your Run, Pear-Pal feature.

Once it's the correct time, sit on one of the stone benches near the statue to trigger a cutscene. The Ghost Sentinel makes its next appearance and at one point tells Nikki that it requires 1 x Celebcrow Feather for Sir Percy's celebration. If you have some feathers on hand, you can immediately give one to the Ghost Sentinel. Otherwise, you will need to gather one from a Celebcrow , which, as its name suggests, is a crow-type bird whose feathers resemble a tuxedo.

As luck would have it, you can find at least two Celebcrows right near the statue. You may have scared them off without realizing while doing the quest's earlier objectives, as they are very skittish birds. Leave the area for a minute and the Celebcrows should return. Next, equip your grooming ability outfit and approach them from a safe distance. You only need to groom one for the Celebcrow Feather you need.

After that's done, bring the feather to the Ghost Sentinel. After a bit more conversation, the quest will conclude and you'll receive the following rewards for your efforts:

  • 30 x Diamonds
  • 100 x Shiny Bubbles
  • 150 x Thread of Purity
  • Mystic Illusion (earrings accessory) sketch

How to Craft Mystic Illusion Earrings in Infinity Nikki

To craft the Mystic Illusion earrings from your quest rewards, you will need just a few simple items that can all be found right in Florawish and Breezy Meadow, or otherwise obtained via one Realm of the Dark challenge.

item.title: Every Assassin's Creed Novel, Ranked
item.description:
The Assassin's Creed series is one of the most popular and recognizable gaming franchises of the last few decades, with 14 games spanning across more than two thousand years of history. In addition to the mainline games, there have also been various other multimedia projects ranging from comic books and board games to feature-length movies and novelizations.

The vast majority of the game's books are written by Anton Gill (pen name Oliver Bowden) and tie-in with events and characters from the games. Each of the works expands greatly on the lore of the franchise and adds depth as well as explanations for many unsolved mysteries. While these are just the official tie-in works, there are also numerous other fan-fiction projects which take the series to locations such as China, Turkey and even Scotland.

10 Assassin's Creed Renaissance

Chronicles The Emergence of Ezio

As the first of the official Assassin's Creed novelizations, Renaissance covers the events of Assassin's Creed 2 such as Ezio's emergence into notoriety following the unjust execution of his family members.

The story takes place primarily in Florence and Venice, and also features prominent figures of the time, including Leonardo da Vinci and Niccolo Machiavelli. Much like the game, it is very action-packed and this is reflected by the fairly simplistic prose and structure.

9 Assassin's Creed Underworld

A Different But Solid Entry In The Series

Set in 1862 London and tying in with Assassin's Creed Syndicate , Underworld follows Jayadeep Mir, also known as "The Ghost", who serves as a mentor to Jacob and Evie Fry. Mir's journey takes him through the underbelly of the city as he seeks to redeem himself after being disgraced by the Order of Assassins.

The book ties up many loose threads from the end of Syndicate 's story and makes for an excellent follow-up to playing the game. Be aware, however, that reading Underworld is likely to spoil some major plot points in Syndicate .

8 Assassin's Creed Odyssey

Traces The Timeline To Its Beginning

Set during the earliest time period of the Assassin's Creed timeline, Assassin's Creed Odyssey takes us back to Greece in 431 BC and follows the story of the mythical warrior Kassandra as she uncovers the mysteries that will kick off events that ring throughout history.

Unfortunately, the game has come under criticism for the way in which it completely omits the game's male protagonist, Alexios, and portrays Kassandra as more of an arrogant and short-tempered character.

7 Assassin's Creed Origins Desert Oath

The Backstory of Bayek

Assassin's Creed Origins: Desert Oath is a prequel to the events of Assassin's Creed: Origins and tells the story of Bayek in Egypt as he sets off on a long journey in search of his father who has mysteriously left Siwa.

For any fans of the Ancient Egyptian setting, Desert Oath is a fantastic addition to the series and provides some valuable context for the events of Assassin's Creed: Origins - a game which was somewhat light on deep and meaningful storytelling.

6 Assassin's Creed Brotherhood

Ezio's Dark Adventures In Rome

Assassin's Creed Brotherhood follows Ezio's exploits in Rome as he seeks to liberate its citizens from the tyranny of the Borgia family. The book is one of the gorier and more action-packed in the series, which really conveys the sense of dread within the oppressive setting.

The story is neat and tightly written, following roughly the same events as the game. However, it does suffer slightly from a lack of polish and depth when compared to some later titles.

5 Assassin's Creed Revelations

The Final Adventure in Ezio's Story

Assassin's Creed Revelations ties in directly with the narrative of the game it is named after and follows the story of an aging Ezio as he travels to Constantinople in search of Altair's secret library.

What makes this book particularly interesting is the way it manages to weave together Ezio's discoveries with flashbacks to events in Altair's lifetime. The dual-narrative really helps to provide a greater understanding of the two characters and how they relate to each other across time.

4 Assassin's Creed The Last Crusade

The Story of the Original Assassin

Assassin's Creed: The Last Crusade tells the story of Altair, the first protagonist in the original Assassin's Creed game, but largely from the perspective of Marco Polo's father, Niccolo.

Of course, learning more about Altair is worthwhile in itself, but the unique narration also adds a great deal of depth to the story and gives it a sense of grandeur. The story combines events from the original game with new events from Altair's life both before and after.

3 Assassin's Creed Unity

Elise's Side of the French Revolution

The Assassin's Creed: Unity novel is largely based upon the events of the game, but told mostly from the perspective of Elise, Arno's lover. It expands beyond this to include more elements of her upbringing and background.

In addition to being a great and immersive setting, Paris during the French Revolution also sees plenty of political intrigue and subterfuge which Elise's family is at the center of. Arno also appears briefly, but very much takes on a secondary role.

2 Assassin's Creed Black Flag

Edward Kenway's Personal Journal

Much like the popular pirate-themed game, Assassin's Creed: Black Flag is an excellent tie-in novel which is presented in the form of Edward Kenway's journal. In addition to getting a much deeper look into Edward's mind and motivation, we also get to experience the turbulent Age of Sail through his eyes.

The writing style is among the best in the series and feels authentic in its presentation. It is particularly interesting to learn more about Edward's life and upbringing, and we get to see much more of his life in England in the novel than we do in the game.

1 Assassin's Creed Forsaken

The Story of Haytham Kenway

Assassin's Creed Forsaken is largely considered the best of the Assassin's Creed novels and for good reason. Following the story of Haytham Kenway, Edward's father and one of Assassin's Creed 3's central characters, it seamlessly connects several storylines together at the vital time of the American revolution.

Spanning from 1735-1783, it gives a comprehensive overview of the changes taking place on the American frontier, and adds plenty in the way of lore to the dynamic of assassins and templars.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: Where Is The Training Area?
item.description:
There are lots of weapons to choose from in Monster Hunter Wilds , with a lot of builds that can be done with each one. Every weapon and monster has different stats that play off of each other, leading to a lot of things to consider when making your character or preparing for a particular hunt.

The Training Area is a great place especially early in the game to test out the combos of different weapons, along with trying out your build against a specific type of enemy to make sure it's effective instead of learning in the moment against a tough monster. Here's where to find the Training Area along with how to customize it.

Where To Find The Training Area In Monster Hunter Wilds

The Training Area can only be found in the Windward Plains Base Camp , the first base camp in the game. You can find and access the training area as soon as you're given the ability to free-roam the camp during the beginning section of the game. The entrance to the Training Area is found along the northern side of the camp, the far backside from the main entrance to the camp.

The entrance to the Training Area is marked with a red sheet over the wooden pillars with weapons all around the entrance, interact with it to enter.

How To Customize The Training Area In Monster Hunter Wilds

Inside the Training Area will be a Makeshift Camp and The Training Area Meownager. At the Makeshift Camp, you can alter your gear to try out different builds and weapons , letting you try out the basics of every major weapon type in a controlled setting. In the middle of the Training Area is the High Purrformance Barrel Puncher, which is the game's training Dummy. At the Training Area Meownger, you can alter the stats and mode of the Puncher:

  • Hide Settings
  • Wound Settings
  • Mode
  • Pattern
  • Orientation
  • Natural Recovery Settings
  • Strength Settings

Inside the Training Area, you can also get free ammo to try out with weapons like Light Bowguns.

All of these are aspects that will be found in monsters deciding how they act and the way they take damage. You can change the stats of the Puncher whenever you'd like , letting you try out your build against a range of options in this safer environment. If you want to make things a bit more real, you can choose to change the Mode of the Puncher and make it active and attack you, letting you practice dodging, blocking, and even parrying.
